channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: GOP gearing up to face tough midterms. And, Pentagon reviews women in ground combat
item.description: Trump offers advice to the GOP as midterm fears grow and he struggles to connect with voters on the economy. And, the Pentagon reviews the "effectiveness" of women in ground combat roles.
item.content:encoded:
Trump offers advice to the GOP as midterm fears grow and he struggles to connect with voters on the economy. And, the Pentagon reviews the "effectiveness" of women in ground combat roles.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Greetings from a Paris park, where a lone sequoia tree is a marvel to behold
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: A walking challenge to start 2026 on your feet — and off your screens
item.description: The solution to too much sitting is simple but hard to stick with. This walking challenge sets you up for success, with six tips to keep you moving throughout your day.
item.content:encoded: The solution to too much sitting is simple but hard to stick with. This walking challenge sets you up for success, with six tips to keep you moving throughout your day.
item.dc:creator: Manoush Zomorodi

item.title: Sick young ants send out a 'kill me' scent to prevent deadly epidemics
item.description: Young, infected Lasius neglectus ants will send out an altruistic "kill me" signal to worker ants, a new study finds, as part of a strategy to keep deadly pathogens from spreading through the colony.
item.content:encoded:
Young, infected Lasius neglectus ants will send out an altruistic "kill me" signal to worker ants, a new study finds, as part of a strategy to keep deadly pathogens from spreading through the colony.

(Image credit: Christopher D. Pull)
item.dc:creator: Arundathi Nair

item.title: Pro-Trump influencers take a victory lap amid fallout from viral video alleging fraud
item.description: The swift policy and political repercussions the video helped propel illustrate the symbiotic relationship between online content creators and the Trump administration's policy goals.
item.content:encoded:
The swift policy and political repercussions the video helped propel illustrate the symbiotic relationship between online content creators and the Trump administration's policy goals.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: The world has too much oil right now. Will companies want Venezuela's?
item.description: Crude prices are low. Companies are being cautious. But huge reserves — particularly of the heavy, viscous oil Venezuela has in abundance — remain appealing.
item.content:encoded:
Crude prices are low. Companies are being cautious. But huge reserves — particularly of the heavy, viscous oil Venezuela has in abundance — remain appealing.

(Image credit: Pedro Mattey)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: After the LA fires, false narratives on social media impacted state policy
item.description: Misinformation spread quickly after the wildfires in Los Angeles last year. Some of these false narratives on social media impacted California policy.
item.content:encoded:
Misinformation spread quickly after the wildfires in Los Angeles last year. Some of these false narratives on social media impacted California policy.

(Image credit: Julia Simon)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: The delightful history behind serendipity suggests it's not mere luck
item.description: While serendipity has often been associated with luck or happy accidents, its origin suggests that it goes beyond just happenstance.
item.content:encoded:
While serendipity has often been associated with luck or happy accidents, its origin suggests that it goes beyond just happenstance.

(Image credit: RGR Collection)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: DHS wants Venezuelans to return home, but fears remain as long as Maduro regime is in power
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have been in limbo since the Trump administration removed their temporary protected status late last year. That uncertainty has intensified as U.S. immigration officials again push for those migrants to return to Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have been in limbo since the Trump administration removed their temporary protected status late last year. That uncertainty has intensified as U.S. immigration officials again push for those migrants to return to Venezuela.

(Image credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: CIA turncoat Aldrich Ames, who sold U.S. secrets to the Soviets, dies in prison at 84
item.description: CIA turncoat Aldrich Ames, who betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging breaches in U.S. history, has died in a Maryland prison. He was 84.
item.content:encoded:
CIA turncoat Aldrich Ames, who betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging breaches in U.S. history, has died in a Maryland prison. He was 84.

(Image credit: Wilfredo Lee)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
